keyPolicies.policyDescription: Prevent countryside from damaging development and find enough places for people to live. Need to protect precious countryside sites and successfully opposed plans to build millionaire mansions on the Green Belt.

Against the proposal for another runway at Gatwick Airport, which would be bigger than Heathrow is now, doubling air traffic to 560,000 flights a year (250,000) and generating at least 40,000 new homes.
Serious about taking action to protect our planet. Rebuild our economy so everyone gets a fair share.
Wrong that more and more people have to leave their families and move to London and the South East to work. That creates pollution and congestion here, and problems for communities elsewhere.
Addressing concerns and affirming support for having to visit Foodbanks to get enough to eat.
Against austerity that has cut and delayed benefits and the minimum wage isn't enough to live on. The Green Party will tackle social injustice and inequality and can shed light on low pay.

mentions.candidate: Jacquetta Fewster works for a local charity, is the active in her local community as a volunteer in community health walks project, and she chairs Transition Dorking's energy group.

issues.economy: We should rebuild our economy so everyone gets a fair share.
issues.environment: Serious about taking climate change to protect our planet.
issues.socialWelfare: Austerity has cut and delayed benefits and the minimum wage isn't enough to live on. The Green Party will tackle social injustice and inequality.

housing.content: Wrong that more and more people have to leave their families and move to London and the South East to work. That creates pollution and congestion here, and problems for communities elsewhere.

images.caption: Jacquetta Fewster with other Green Party members.
